Headline: Evening Update: Today's headlines from The Straits Times on June 16, Singapore News & Top Stories - The Straits Times
Text: Read 3 articles daily and stand to win ST rewards, including the ST News Tablet worth $398.Spin the wheel for ST Read and Win now.Good evening! Catch up on some of the main headlines on Wednesday, June 16. Dining in at F&B outlets was scheduled to resume on June 21 if the situation remained under control.READ MORE HEREConducted once every 10 years, the census is the largest national survey on Singapore's population.READ MORE HEREThis is a first for the nation and a ground-breaking development for its maritime heritage.READ MORE HEREThe mall, which has 400 retailers, reopened its doors at 10am. READ MORE HEREOf the linked cases, 10 had already been quarantined, while the other six were detected through surveillance.READ MORE HERESales across all pharmacies are currently limited to 10 kits per person.READ MORE HEREOver the last week, Sultan Abdullah Ahmad Shah had granted audiences to political party leaders across the divide.READ MORE HEREFrenchman Christopher Bousigues, 45, has just arrived to assume his post, and is under a stay-home notice.READ MORE HERELim Tze Peng turns 100 in September, but he is not one to let his age - or a pandemic, for that matter - get in the way of his art.READ MORE HEREThe celebrity meal will launch in Singapore next Monday.READ MORE HEREJoin ST's Telegram channel here and get the latest breaking news delivered to you.SPH Digital News / Copyright © 2021 Singapore Press Holdings Ltd.
